alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:59PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern West Baton Rouge, east central Iberville and southwestern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 430 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Baton Rouge, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny to nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Addis, Brusly, Westminster, Merrydale, Inniswold, Village St. George, Gardere, Brownfields, Old Jefferson, Shenandoah and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 148 and 166. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
